title: Cloud Threat Graph Lab - Interactive Learning Guide
description: General guidance for cybersecurity education using Jupyter notebooks

instructions.title: 🎓 Welcome to Security Learning!
instructions.content:
Welcome to the Cloud Threat Graph Lab!

This interactive learning platform teaches cybersecurity through hands-on analysis of real-world scenarios.

🎯 What You'll Learn:

  • 🔍 Graph-Based Analysis: Understand security relationships
  • ⚔️ Attack Path Discovery: See how threats spread
  • 🛡️ MITRE ATT&CK: Industry-standard threat classification
  • 🤖 ML Security: AI-powered anomaly detection
💡 Learning Approach: Interactive, hands-on, and connected to real security work!

instructions.title: 🗺️ Your Learning Journey
instructions.content:
Here's your recommended path through the Cloud Threat Graph Lab:

📚 Suggested Learning Sequence:

  1. Start Here: 00-Getting-Started-TUTORIAL.ipynb
    Learn Jupyter basics (10 min)
  2. Foundations: 01-Graph-Fundamentals.ipynb
    Master security graph concepts (45 min)
  3. Advanced Analysis: 02-Attack-Path-Discovery.ipynb
    Complex attack analysis techniques (60 min)
  4. AI Security: 05-Anomaly-Detection-ML.ipynb
    Machine learning for security (75 min)
🎮 Practice Platform: Use the dashboard to practice what you learn!

instructions.title: 🔧 Essential Jupyter Skills
instructions.content:
Master these core Jupyter skills for effective learning:

⌨️ Key Shortcuts:

  • Shift + Enter - Run current cell and move to next
  • Ctrl + Enter - Run current cell and stay
  • A - Insert cell above (command mode)
  • B - Insert cell below (command mode)
  • M - Change to markdown cell
  • Y - Change to code cell

🛠️ Essential Operations:

  • Run All: Cell → Run All Cells
  • Restart Kernel: Kernel → Restart Kernel
  • Clear Output: Cell → All Output → Clear
🚨 Golden Rule: Always run cells from top to bottom in order!

instructions.title: 🎮 Interactive Learning Features
instructions.content:
This learning platform includes several interactive features to enhance your education:

🎯 Learning Tools Available:

  • 📱 Dashboard Integration: Practice scenarios
  • 🗃️ Database Browser: Neo4j queries
  • 📊 Code Examples: Ready-to-run security analysis
  • 🧪 Challenges: Test your skills with practice problems

💡 Learning Strategy:

  1. Read the concepts in text cells
  2. Run the code examples
  3. Practice on the dashboard
  4. Experiment with modifications
🎯 Success Tip: Active practice beats passive reading - run every code example!

instructions.title: 🧪 Try Your First Security Query
instructions.content:
Let's run a simple security analysis to get you started!

🔍 What This Example Does:

  • Connects to the security database
  • Runs a basic inventory query
  • Shows different types of security assets
  • Demonstrates fundamental concepts

📊 Understanding the Results:

  • Each row represents a type of security asset
  • The count shows how many of each type exist
  • This inventory is the foundation of security analysis
💡 Connection: This same data powers all the dashboard scenarios!

instructions.title: 🛠️ Troubleshooting Common Issues
instructions.content:
Every learner encounters issues - here's how to solve the most common ones:

🚨 Common Problems & Solutions:

ProblemSolution
"ModuleNotFoundError"Restart kernel and run setup cells
"Connection failed"Check Docker services are running
"Variable not defined"Run all cells from the beginning
"Kernel appears to be dead"Kernel → Restart & Run All

🔄 Universal Fix: When in doubt, restart everything!

✅ Remember: Technical issues are learning opportunities - don't get discouraged!

instructions.title: 🚀 Ready to Start Your Security Journey!
instructions.content:
🎉 You're ready to become a cybersecurity expert!

✅ You Now Know:

  • 🗺️ How to navigate the learning platform
  • ⌨️ Essential Jupyter notebook skills
  • 🎯 The recommended learning sequence
  • 🛠️ How to troubleshoot common issues

🚀 Next Steps:

  1. If you're new to Jupyter: Start with 00-Getting-Started-TUTORIAL.ipynb
  2. If you know Jupyter: Jump to 01-Graph-Fundamentals.ipynb
  3. Want to practice immediately: Visit the dashboard
  4. Ready for challenges: Try 02-Attack-Path-Discovery.ipynb

🎯 Learning Philosophy:

Security is about understanding relationships, patterns, and behaviors. Every concept you learn here applies directly to protecting real systems from cyber threats.

🛡️ Let's make the digital world more secure! 🚀
